summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Evan Almighty
Review Date: 2019/02/07
Categories: Comedy, Fantasy, Fun
Product Description: ["When God instructs him to build an ark, Evan's life goes from overnight success to almighty mess!"]
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tom Shadyac'], 'Producers': ['Tom Shadyac', 'Gary Barber', 'Roger Birnbaum', 'Neal H. Moritz', 'Michael Bostick'], 'Starring': ['Steve Carell', 'Morgan Freeman', 'Lauren Graham']}
Review Text: At first my kids didn't want to see this.  This wasn't their kind of movies.  I didn't have high expectations either.  However, the main actor who played Evan was the star of the show. He did an excellent job of potraying a nutty and off the wall character.
Review Title: First time I've geniunely laughed in a long time.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2019/03/14
Average Rating: 3.7
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Mark Marchillo'], 'Producers': ['Micah E. Brandt'], 'Starring': ['Richard Riehle', 'Chris Kattan', 'Lee Meriwether'], 'Studio': ['Vision Films']}
Review Text: Have you ever watched a movie and wished you hadn't?  I regret watching this with my children.  I thought this would be an inspirational movie revolving around dance and although I like the minimal dance performances by "Bloom", the rest of the movie was full of morally messed up characters.
Review Title: Young teens kissing/ Adults doing nothing to stop bullying/Immoral ending
Rating: 1.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2019/04/01
Average Rating: 3.9
Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Thomas Borch Nielse'], 'Producers': ['Nina Crone'], 'Starring': ['Jane Lynch'], 'Studio': ['Phase 4 Films (USA)', 'LLC']}
Review Text: "It's fun, funky, and amazing", said my child.  Actually, even the teens watched it and they usually stay away from "kiddies shows".  I found it surprisingly entertaining too and I couldn't help but boogie along with the music.
Review Title: My kids love it.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2019/04/06
Average Rating: 3.1
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['עברית'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tzipi Baider']}
Review Text: The love and devotion that this family have for each other gives me hope that there is still good in this world.  The birth of the baby girl and the joy that she gave everyone brought me to tears.  I wish this family much happiness.
Review Title: A beautiful story
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2019/04/12
Average Rating: 3.6
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Nina May'], 'Producers': ['Nina May'], 'Starring': ['Joshua Blake', 'Scott Clark', 'Kristine Cornils'], 'Studio': ['Willette Acquisition Corp.', 'DBA Allied Vaughn']}
Review Text: We enjoyed listening to a bit of mountain/bluegrass music played in the background.  This show has a positive message about faith and humility which our whole family needed a reminder of.  We finished this movie happier than when we started.  Now that's a mark of a good movie.
Review Title: Inspirational & great to watch with the kids.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2019/05/04
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Billie Woodruff'], 'Producers': ['David Hoberman', 'George Tillman Jr.', 'Louise Rosner', 'Otis Best', 'Queen Latifah', 'Robert Teitel', 'Shakim Compere'], 'Starring': ['Queen Latifah', 'Alicia Silverstone', 'Andie MacDowell']}
Review Text: What was so humorous about this movie?  The numerous talks about having sex with a hot guy, bikini waxing, climaxing and other sexual innuendos?  The dissing of the white hairdresser because she wants to "act black"?  Queen Latifah was the only good thing about this movie.  It's rated PG-13 but it's not appropriate for my family.
Review Title: Not that funny
Rating: 2.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Text: I'm an old lady who isn't familiar with Indian culture or rap music.  However, I'm so impressed by the artistry of Gully Boy's music and his story of proclaiming self-worth and self-identity despite of one's origin.  I finished this movie feeling elated and hopeful about my life.
Review Title: I didn't expect to like this!
Rating: 5.0

Review Title: Love it.

=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2020/10/30
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kevin Connor'], 'Producers': ['H. Daniel Gross', 'Erik Heiberg', 'Lincoln Lageson', 'Larry Levinson', 'Randy Pope'], 'Starring': ['Jennifer Esposito', 'David Sutcliffe', 'Mark Deklin'], 'Studio': ['Larry Levinson Productions']}
Review Text: I like romantic stories about how someone who might not seem compatible with you at first but later discovers he/she is actually the best person for you.  The actors played their parts very well.
Review Title: Fun
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2020/11/25
Average Rating: 3.9
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Eric Nemoto'], 'Producers': ['Eric Nemoto', 'Dann Seki', 'Larry Cortez', 'Mark Bush'], 'Starring': ['Dann Seki', 'Kristen Nemoto Jay', 'Jim Aina'], 'Studio': ['Yellow Brick Studio']}
Review Text: I've never seen a movie like this - with virtually no actions or scenes - but is actually more captivating than many of the movies I've seen in the past 50+ years. I've seen so many movies/tv shows that I get bored easily, so it says a lot that I didn't change this "channel". The main actor is superb.  I'm not sure how many others could have pulled off this movie like he did. His facial expressions and his intonation spoke volumes. And kudos to all the voices behind the phone calls. We never see their faces but I could picture them in my head.
Review Title: Unique and surprisingly entertaining.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2020/12/11
Average Rating: 4.2
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'Español'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jeff Beesely'], 'Producers': ['Bruce Cohn Curtis', 'Will Dixon', 'Stephen Onda', 'Mark Reid', 'Lance H. Robbins'], 'Starring': ['Gabrielle Anwar', 'Max Martini', 'Diego Wallraff'], 'Studio': ['All Channel Films']}
Review Text: Boring. Slow. Scenes filled with suspenseful music to cover up no dialogues or actions. Worse of all, the role of Lisa Monroe as a cop was pathetic. No cop in real life could come close to being as incompetent as she is.
Review Title: A waste of time
Rating: 1.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2020/12/12
Average Rating: 3.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Brian Skiba'], 'Producers': ['Vincent De Paul', 'Christian Filippella', 'Gloria Kisel', 'Kip Konwiser', 'Kirsten Lea', 'Donna Spangler'], 'Starring': ['Dean Cain', 'John Savage', 'Donna Spangler'], 'Studio': ['ITN Distribution', 'Inc.']}
Review Text: Not what I had expected. We take so much for granted that we can become self centered or blind to the blessings that we do have. I am guilty of both. This movie touched my heart and opened my eyes to faith, love, and hope. Faith that God cares about me. Love that I can give, especially to those who are hurting. And hope for the future even in life's dark moments.
Review Title: Beautiful story.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: MOMMY, I DIDN'T DO IT
Review Date: 2020/12/22
Categories: Drama, Dark, Mysterious, Tense
Product Description: ['Starring Danica McKellar. In a follow-up to The Wrong Woman, lawyer Ellen must defend teen daughter Julie, who has been charged with murdering a teacher she was rumored to be having an affair with.']
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Check Entertainment'], 'Producers': ['Richard Gabai', 'Michael Amato', 'Markus Bishop-Hill', 'John Constantine', 'Gary Garfinkel', 'Larry Greenberg', 'Jeff Murphy']}
Review Text: I watched this because I have always enjoyed everything that feature Danica McKellar. Her acting didn't disappoint. She played her character so well that at times I empathize with her while other times, I just want to yell at her. Page Searcy played a teenager's attitudes and behaviors so well that she reminded me of my own teens.  It was frustrating to watch at times because the plot seemed ridiculously unfair and unrealistic. However, it redeemed itself with a happy ending.
Review Title: Danica McKellar
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2021/01/15
Average Rating: 3.8
Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Indy Entertainment'], 'Producers': ['Ross Kohn', 'Brant Boivin', 'Alan Chu', 'Gary Glushon', 'Stanton W. Kamens', 'Jonathan Keasey', 'Catherine Kim', 'Nancy Leopardi', 'Tim Mikulecky', 'Doug Miller'], 'Studio': ['Lifetime']}
Review Text: It was frustrating to watch how immature the mom looked and behaved. She didn't act much older than her 16 year old daughter. She should've told her kids about the abuse at the beginning, kept her money with her, and not befriend a stranger, especially a male. He could be a psychopath. In real life, she and her kids could've end up badly. But, in the world of movies, they have a happy ending.
Review Title: Can't stand the mom. Unrealistic ending.
Rating: 2.0
--------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
**Genuine Preferences and Patterns:**

- **Family-Friendly Content:** High interest in movies featuring positive family values, humor, and inspirational themes. Preference for content suitable for children and teenagers.
  
- **Comedy & Laughter:** Enjoys comedic elements and light-hearted stories that evoke genuine laughter. Responds positively to entertaining performances.

- **Inspirational & Faith-Based Themes:** Favorable towards films that convey messages of faith, hope, love, and personal growth. Significant appreciation for content that uplifts and inspires.

- **Character-Driven Narratives:** Enjoys character development and stories highlighting personal struggles and transformations. Thrives on relatable characters and emotional arcs.

- **Critical Reviews of Morality:** Tends to critique films with poor moral content or inappropriate themes, expressing disappointment in those that do not meet familial standards.

- **Adult Romantic Comedies:** Shows nuances in taste for romantic comedies, favoring relationship dynamics based on friendship and trust, while critiquing sexual content and immorality.

- **Surprise Engagement:** Open to new genres (e.g., Indian culture/rap) that lead to unexpected positive reactions. 

Overall, this individual's purchase history reflects a strong preference for family-friendly, comedic, and inspirational content, with a critical eye towards morality in films.

target_interaction.title: One of the best films ever
target_interaction.text: The storyline is beautiful.  The location is beautiful.  The food is beautiful.  The actors are beautiful.  The racial and cultural biases, at best, and animosity, at worst, were ugly on both sides.  However, the friendships and love that came when both parties chose to stop fighting were inspirational.  This film made me cry, laugh, and hungry.  Most importantly, I feel my spirit uplifted.
